page.title: 08FARMING _ CLEE HILL AREA
page.content: In the area, the farmland is mostly used for{grazing, hay making {and silage,}because the ground is not suitable for corn. On the higher common land, the grassland is mainly used for{sheep grazing.}There are also a few{beef cattle.}On the lower ground, around Hope Bagot and Whitton, some{corn}is grown. Here, the good fields are{strip grazed}by{dairy {cattle.}The ground is moist and the grass grows in a short time. Some of the milk is sent to Cadbury's and some is bottled and sold locally. The farms on the higher land have to shelter their sheep in the winter because of severe weather conditions. On Clee Hill there is a small{ {turkey farm.}They hatch the eggs there and bring up the little chicks. The chicks are then sent to another farm to be fattened up for slaughter.
